intro: Sonchus virgatus, commonly known as common sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that grows up to 60 cm tall, featuring hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, followed by small, spiky seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and fields, and is considered a weed in agricultural settings. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
